## Main purpose and functionality

The `wifi_setApMacAddressControlMode` function sets the MAC address filter control mode for the specified access point. The filter mode can be disabled, enabled as a whitelist, or enabled as a blacklist.

## Key operations and data flow

The function takes two parameters:

* `apIndex`: The index of the access point for which to set the MAC address filter control mode.
* `filterMode`: The MAC address filter control mode to set. This parameter can be one of the following values:
    * 0: MAC address filtering is disabled.
    * 1: MAC address filtering is enabled as a whitelist. Only devices with MAC addresses that are included in the whitelist are allowed to connect to the access point.
    * 2: MAC address filtering is enabled as a blacklist. Only devices with MAC addresses that are not included in the blacklist are allowed to connect to the access point.

The function sets the MAC address filter control mode for the specified access point and returns a status code.

## Interaction with other components (if any)

The function interacts with the Wi-Fi driver to set the MAC address filter control mode for the specified access point.

## Important parameters and return values

The following parameters are important to note:

* `apIndex`: The index of the access point for which to set the MAC address filter control mode. This parameter must be a valid access point index.
* `filterMode`: The MAC address filter control mode to set. This parameter must be one of the following values:
    * 0: MAC address filtering is disabled.
    * 1: MAC address filtering is enabled as a whitelist.
    * 2: MAC address filtering is enabled as a blacklist.

The function returns one of the following status codes:

* `RETURN_OK`: The function completed successfully.
* `RETURN_ERR`: The function failed to complete successfully.

## Any specific RDK-related operations

The function is not specific to RDK. It is a general Wi-Fi function that can be used in any RDK-based system.
